title: Forked hardhat node becomes unresponsive when connecting with Metamask
body:
After upgrading to v2.8.4 I started to receive this error.
How can I increase the memory size?

```
<--- Last few GCs --->

[2096:000002B2E4087E60]  1317204 ms: Scavenge (reduce) 2046.2 (2082.6) -> 2045.5 (2082.6) MB, 4.7 / 0.0 ms  (average mu
```

Did you modify anything in your project?

Try this to increase the memory limit: https://stackoverflow.com/a/64409997

The same thing happens for me, the forked network works until eth_feehistory gets called with 1024 blocks as a parameter. 
Then hardhat hangs and eventually throw ```FATAL ERROR: Ineffective mark-compacts near heap limit Allocation failed - JavaScript heap out of memory```
@aliveli186 are you also running `eth_feeHistory`?

> @aliveli186 are you also running `eth_feeHistory`?

I think any command locks the node. With me 2nd connection blocks it, like when MetaMask tries to connect.
I guess it's first commands are get block number, get balance kind of things...

What do you mean by "locks the node"?

Note that it only attends to 1 query at the time.

> What do you mean by "locks the node"?
> 
> Note that it only attends to 1 query at the time.

I mean node doesn't respond to RPC calls and after some time it throws this out of memory error.

I didn't modify anything in my project, but I also encountered this problem...
I'm not sure if it's a metamask, or a hardhat problem...

With me it started few days ago after upgrading to v2.8.4. But I also upgraded other packages as well.
Now trying to set up another computer to be able to continue to work, I hope.

PS: I'm forking mainnet ethereum from alchemy.

And it's not just after second connection. Once I receive this error I kill the instance and re-run the node "call npx hardhat node" this time it's totally not accepting any connection.
I tried killing any processes listening to 8545 but they are the node itself and nothing works. Totally stuck.
try downgrade your metamask to version 10.8.1. It works for me.

Can you please create some way to reproduce it? A repo would be ideal.

Without one there's not much we can do.

> try downgrade your metamask to version 10.8.1. It works for me.

Yes, it is a workaround but not a solution :)

> Can you please create some way to reproduce it? A repo would be ideal.
> 
> Without one there's not much we can do.

1) Run this:
`npx hardhat node --fork https://eth-mainnet.alchemyapi.io/v2/ghNw_FSe4fGg35lmhDpvHy8PzQYee5pJ`

2) Add Hardhat local node network connection details to MetaMask
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8914034/153930244-69bd83fa-6039-4da7-8ccf-2ef82b3a1497.png)

3) Switch between chains and when you get back to the local node go to "Settings-> Advanced -> Reset Account" reset it and it will freeze both MetaMask and the node.
If it doesn't at the first try to switch between networks and connect to local node again and try to reset the account again. It freezes eventually.

My MetaMask Version is 10.9.2 but I don't think it's MetaMask issue because the same freezing happens when I run my hardhat deploy script. It can't connect to the local node.

Same happens to me, as soon as I try to execute a transaction using mainnet fork Metamask shows the approval with "0" estimated gas and the confirm button is grey out.

After a minute I got this from the console:

```
eth_feeHistory

  If you think this is a bug in Hardhat, please report it here: https://hardhat.org/reportbug

eth_feeHistory

  If you think this is a bug in Hardhat, please report it here: https://hardhat.org/reportbug


<--- Last few GCs --->

[43427:0x148008000]   148387 ms: Mark-sweep 3894.3 (4131.1) -> 3880.6 (4129.5) MB, 3263.3 / 0.5 ms  (average mu = 0.246, current mu = 0.167) task scavenge might not succeed
[43427:0x148008000]   153287 ms: Mark-sweep 3896.7 (4129.9) -> 3883.5 (4130.0) MB, 2650.6 / 0.4 ms  (average mu = 0.361, current mu = 0.459) task scavenge might not succeed
```

I also have this issue while indexing using a theGraph node, but in those cases starting the instance again works fine

As @linyuliang stated it seems to be a MetaMask issue.

I was working on `Microsoft Edge Version 98.0.1108.50 (Official build) (64-bit)` with `MetaMask Version 10.9.2` installed.
This version of MetaMask on Edge browser is causing the error but it works fine on Chrome.

I removed the extension from Edge and I noticed that `10.9.2` version is no longer the latest version for Edge (probably removed due to bugs like that), there is `MetaMask Version 10.7.1` as the latest version and it works fine with Edge.
For now I don't have issues.

> @lcamargof Try to reset the account because when u spawn a new node the account's nonce value stays as it was on the previous node. On a new node it has to start from 0 again.
> 
> Probably the gas estimation problem is due to this nonce mismatch.
> 
> `MetaMask: "Settings-> Advanced -> Reset Account"`

Thanks! but I'm familiar with that issue (I already tried), this is def related to Metamask, I'll try to downgrade it on chrome and see if it solves the issue.

Also something weird, if I cancel the TX the hardhat instance doesn't run out of memory but metamask will refuse to connect to localhost even if I restart the hardhat node.

**Edit:** tried it with Brave browser, no luck

> Also something weird, if I cancel the TX the hardhat instance doesn't run out of memory but metamask will refuse to connect to localhost even if I restart the hardhat node.

If it can't connect your node probably is not responding like with my case. Try installing MetaMask on a second browser and check if connects from there but I doubt, node is dead. If you wait long enough I think you'll receive the out of memory error on your node window.

If on restart of a new node MetaMask doesn't connect there could be some other instance of MetaMask that tried to connect and triggered that bug so the new one can't...
Just sharing I'm experiencing the same issues that got introduced recently in the past week. I cannot get hardhat to function at all due to these issues, tried bumping my node memory too

Related issue on the metamask repo https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/issues/13638

Changing the chainId is another workaround
So is `1337` chainId recommended again?
This problem seems to be related to MM now using `eth_feeHistory`. We'll investigate this asap.

@alcuadrado I wanted to check in to see if there is a status update here on this at all?

Is the suggestion to move away from 31337 for local hardhat development?
No concrete update yet. We identified where this is coming from, but not the root of the problem.

Hello everyone,
Today after I did some investigation, I manage to create a workaround by downgrading MM to 10.7.1 which is the version before the latest `Arrow Glacier` hard fork that happened on 9th Dec. 
I successfully managed to work with my application and create transactions. I also noticed that the problem appeared after this `eth_feeHistory` command was introduced. 
P.S. In version 10.7.1 I noticed that `eth_feeHistory` was not called. In the latest version 10.9.3 it was constantly called.

As @peculiarity points out, my setup basically stopped working around the latest `Arrow Glacier` update.
I haven't upgraded any dependencies.

My issues are similar to @aliveli186 and can be reproduced by the steps outlined in his comment.

Tried downgrading MM to 10.7.1 as @peculiarity suggested, but that didn't work for me. 
I also noticed `eth_feeHistory` being called a lot, starting MM `10.9.3`.  

When i upgrade Hardhat to the latest `2.9.0` version, I'm also experiencing the GC errors. 

Currently I'm unable to properly fork mainnet using hardhat completely. 

Toggling my hardhat neworks `chainId` config between `1337` and `31337` seems to introduce more issues than it solves.
We started experiencing the same errors recently, without upgrading anything, on the server side using a hardhat fork, we see eth_feeHistory being called and nothing responding
@alcuadrado could you share another update out on this by the end of the week?
does anyone knows of a solution for this? all of our workflow depends on hardhat working  :S
**Update:** We can now reproduce this reliably and have identified the source of the problem. We are exploring different ways to fix it.
